parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.
A leprous person, a leper. From the same as lepra; scaly, i.e. Leprous.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
As a free gift, without payment, freely. Accusative case of dorea as adverb; gratuitously.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
As a free gift, without payment, freely. Accusative case of dorea as adverb; gratuitously.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
